subject: RE: [junit] Junit target not being executed by Ant
msgSnippet: Anything in what your forked stuck trying to read standard input, or similar? That (err) can fork up a fork... I believe ant isn t running it cos you aren t

Anything in what your forked stuck trying to read standard input, or
similar? That (err) can fork up a fork...

I believe ant isn't running it 'cos you aren't getting there. Try an <echo
instead of trying antrun or junit. If you aren't getting there, post to the
ant list 'cos it isn't junit.

Tried ant -debug?

regards

Adam
  -----Original Message-----
  From: billy.bacon@... [mailto:billy.bacon@...]
  Sent: Friday, August 01, 2003 12:03 PM
  To: junit@yahoogroups.com
  Subject: RE: [junit] Junit target not being executed by Ant


  I already have this for starting tomcat....

  <java classname="org.apache.catalina.startup.Bootstrap"
  fork="true">

  Any other ideas?

  - Billy -


  On Fri, 1 Aug 2003 13:52:36 -0400, "Stirling, Scott"
  wrote:





  > -----Original Message-----
  > From: billy.bacon@...
  [mailto:billy.bacon@...]
  [...]
  > I have an ant target which starts tomcat and I have
  > another target which calls the <junit> task to execute
  > my unit tests...
  >
  > My deploy.test target depends on starting tomcat and
  > then makes an <antcall target> to my 'test' target
  > which executes my tests. It seems to be hanging after
  > tomcat is started successfully. Has anyone come across
  > this issue before.
  >
  > Example:
  > <target name="deploy.test" depends="clean, tc">
  > <!-- clean target just deletes the build dir -->
  > <!-- tc target starts tomcat -->
  > <antcall target="test"> <!-- executes unit tests -->
  > </target>

  I'd guess you aren't forking the Java or the exec
  you're using in the tc target to start Tomcat.

  Scott Stirling
  Framingham, MA
